meta.name: Real-Time Startup Intelligence: Crunchbase Monitoring with AI Summaries & Email Alerts

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "subject": "üöÄ Crunchbase Company Updates - June 5, 2025",
  "body": "üöÄ Here's a summary of recent company updates from Crunchbase:

üîπ **OpenAI**
AI research and deployment company.
Industry: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning
Location: San Francisco, USA
Last Updated: June 5, 2025

üîπ **DeepMind**
Solving intelligence to benefit humanity.
Industry: Deep Learning, Healthcare
Location: London, GBR
Last Updated: June 5, 2025"
}

options.systemMessage:
You are a helpful assistant that writes email-ready summaries of recent company updates from Crunchbase. 

The input contains data about recently updated organizations including their name, description, categories, location, and update time.

Summarize the companies clearly in a professional tone. Include:
- Company name (bold or highlighted)
- One-line description
- Industry/categories (comma-separated)
- Location (City, Country)
- Last updated time (formatted)

Format it for a human reader in plain text or HTML for email use. Use line breaks or bullet points to separate companies.
Avoid repeating keys or technical jargon.

parameters.content:
## üîπ **SECTION 1: Data Collection & Preprocessing**

### üìç Nodes Involved:

* ‚úÖ `Trigger Manual Test`
* üåê `Fetch Crunchbase Updates`
* ‚úèÔ∏è `Extract Company Details`

---

### üß© 1. `Trigger Manual Test` üñ±Ô∏è

**Purpose:** This node is just for testing. It lets you **manually start** your workflow with a click.

> üí° In production, replace this with a **cron node** ‚è∞ if you want this workflow to run **automatically every day**.

---

### üåê 2. `Fetch Crunchbase Updates` (HTTP Request)

**Purpose:** This node sends a request to the [Crunchbase API](https://data.crunchbase.com/docs) to **fetch companies updated in the last 24 hours**.

üîß Here's what it does:

* Makes a **GET request** to:
  `https://api.crunchbase.com/api/v4/entities/organizations`
* Adds parameters:

  * `user_key`: Your Crunchbase API key üîê
  * `updated_since`: Yesterday‚Äôs date üìÖ

> ‚úÖ It returns a **list of updated companies** including names, descriptions, locations, and industries.

---

### ‚úèÔ∏è 3. `Extract Company Details`

**Purpose:** Crunchbase API data can be complex. This node simplifies things.

üõ† It:

* Extracts **essential fields only** like:

  * Name üè¢
  * Description üìñ
  * Location üìç
  * Industry üè≠
  * Last Updated Date üóìÔ∏è
* Prepares this data for the AI summarizer in a clean format.

> üí° This step ensures only the relevant information is passed forward, saving processing time and cost.

---

## üß† **SECTION 2: AI Summary + Email Delivery**

### ü§ñ Nodes Involved:

* üß† `Summarize Company Updates`
* üí¨ `OpenAI Chat (GPT-4 or GPT-3.5)`
* üîé `Parse JSON Email Summary`

---

### ü§ñ 4. `Summarize Company Updates` (AI Agent)

**Purpose:** This is where the **magic happens**. It takes the company data and feeds it to an AI to generate a **plain-English summary**.

üõ† It connects with:

* `OpenAI Chat Model` (GPT-4 / 3.5):
  Generates clear, readable summaries.
* `Structured Output Parser`:
  Forces the AI to return a **valid JSON object** with:

  * `subject`: for the email subject line
  * `body`: the plain text of the email

üìú **System Prompt Used**:

```txt
You are a helpful assistant that summarizes Crunchbase company updates.

Output your response strictly as valid JSON with two properties: 
- "subject": a string for the email subject line.
- "body": a string for the email content formatted in plain text. Use "\n" for new lines inside the string.

Do NOT output anything other than the JSON object.  
Ensure the JSON is well-formed with no trailing commas or syntax errors.
```

---

### üîé 5. `Parse JSON Email Summary` (Structured Output Parser)

**Purpose:** Ensures that the response from the AI is valid JSON and separates `subject` and `body`.

‚úÖ Without this, n8n can't reliably extract the email content from the AI's response.

---

## üß† **SECTION 3: Send email with summary (Gmail)

**Purpose:** Finally, this node sends you an email üì® with the Crunchbase update summaries.

üõ† It uses:

* `{{$json.subject}}` for the email subject
* `{{$json.body}}` for the content

=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
   - LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
=======================================

üß† Automating Crunchbase Insights with n8n

### üìà Get Daily Company Updates ‚Üí ü§ñ Summarize ‚Üí üìß Email Digest

This workflow helps you stay informed on the latest company activity (from Crunchbase) by automating the entire process ‚Äî fetching updates, summarizing them with AI, and emailing them to you daily.

---

## üîπ **SECTION 1: Data Collection & Preprocessing**

### üìç Nodes Involved:

* ‚úÖ `Trigger Manual Test`
* üåê `Fetch Crunchbase Updates`
* ‚úèÔ∏è `Extract Company Details`

---

### üß© 1. `Trigger Manual Test` üñ±Ô∏è

**Purpose:** This node is just for testing. It lets you **manually start** your workflow with a click.

> üí° In production, replace this with a **cron node** ‚è∞ if you want this workflow to run **automatically every day**.

---

### üåê 2. `Fetch Crunchbase Updates` (HTTP Request)

**Purpose:** This node sends a request to the [Crunchbase API](https://data.crunchbase.com/docs) to **fetch companies updated in the last 24 hours**.

üîß Here's what it does:

* Makes a **GET request** to:
  `https://api.crunchbase.com/api/v4/entities/organizations`
* Adds parameters:

  * `user_key`: Your Crunchbase API key üîê
  * `updated_since`: Yesterday‚Äôs date üìÖ

> ‚úÖ It returns a **list of updated companies** including names, descriptions, locations, and industries.

---

### ‚úèÔ∏è 3. `Extract Company Details`

**Purpose:** Crunchbase API data can be complex. This node simplifies things.

üõ† It:

* Extracts **essential fields only** like:

  * Name üè¢
  * Description üìñ
  * Location üìç
  * Industry üè≠
  * Last Updated Date üóìÔ∏è
* Prepares this data for the AI summarizer in a clean format.

> üí° This step ensures only the relevant information is passed forward, saving processing time and cost.

---

## üß† **SECTION 2: AI Summary + Email Delivery**

### ü§ñ Nodes Involved:

* üß† `Summarize Company Updates`
* üí¨ `OpenAI Chat (GPT-4 or GPT-3.5)`
* üîé `Parse JSON Email Summary`
* üì¨ `Send Email with Summary`

---

### ü§ñ 4. `Summarize Company Updates` (AI Agent)

**Purpose:** This is where the **magic happens**. It takes the company data and feeds it to an AI to generate a **plain-English summary**.

üõ† It connects with:

* `OpenAI Chat Model` (GPT-4 / 3.5):
  Generates clear, readable summaries.
* `Structured Output Parser`:
  Forces the AI to return a **valid JSON object** with:

  * `subject`: for the email subject line
  * `body`: the plain text of the email

üìú **System Prompt Used**:

```txt
You are a helpful assistant that summarizes Crunchbase company updates.

Output your response strictly as valid JSON with two properties: 
- "subject": a string for the email subject line.
- "body": a string for the email content formatted in plain text. Use "\n" for new lines inside the string.

Do NOT output anything other than the JSON object.  
Ensure the JSON is well-formed with no trailing commas or syntax errors.
```

---

### üîé 5. `Parse JSON Email Summary` (Structured Output Parser)

**Purpose:** Ensures that the response from the AI is valid JSON and separates `subject` and `body`.

‚úÖ Without this, n8n can't reliably extract the email content from the AI's response.

---

### üìß 6. `Send Email with Summary` (Gmail)

**Purpose:** Finally, this node sends you an email üì® with the Crunchbase update summaries.

üõ† It uses:

* `{{$json.subject}}` for the email subject
* `{{$json.body}}` for the content

> üí° You can configure this to send it to your **team**, **investors**, or even yourself daily to stay updated.

---

## üèÅ What This Workflow Does for You

‚ú® **Effortlessly monitor industry trends**
üì¨ **Get a beautifully summarized digest every day**
‚è≥ **Save hours of manual research**
üí° **Perfect for startup founders, analysts, investors, and marketers**

---

## ‚úÖ Bonus Tip for Beginners

To make this **run automatically every day**, add this node at the top:

* üïí `Cron Node`
  Set schedule: every day at 8 AM (or whenever you like)

---
